timeline.message:
Minor code improvements; Added nullness annotations to ThingActions and ThingHandlerService

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

timeline.body:
A `ThingHandlerService` will be initialized directly after a `ThingHandler` will have been initialized. Thus I am not sure if the return value of this method really could be `null`.

Current [implementations](https://github.com/openhab/openhab-addons/search?q=ThingHandlerService&unscoped_q=ThingHandlerService) are using both ways - Either use `@Nullable` or `@NonNullByDefault({})` to annotate a `thingHandler` property. Which one is preferred?

https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/blob/3811cb95604f69f6a3d77da2caf391d81b05458e/bundles/org.openhab.core.thing/src/main/java/org/openhab/core/thing/binding/BaseThingHandlerFactory.java#L150-L153
timeline.bodyHTML:
A ThingHandlerService will be initialized directly after a ThingHandler will have been initialized. Thus I am not sure if the return value of this method really could be null.

Current implementations are using both ways - Either use @Nullable or @NonNullByDefault({}) to annotate a thingHandler property. Which one is preferred?

openhab-core/bundles/org.openhab.core.thing/src/main/java/org/openhab/core/thing/binding/BaseThingHandlerFactory.java

Lines 150 to 153 in 3811cb9

if (serviceInstance instanceof ThingHandlerService) {
ths = (ThingHandlerService) serviceInstance;
ths.setThingHandler(thingHandler);
} else {
timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Note sure. Going for @Nullable leaves us more flexibility wrt lifecyle - who knows, if we come across a situation, where it is valid to have no thingHandler available.
replies.author: kaikreuzer

timeline.message:
Revert renaming of 'thingRegistry' property

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>
